Mindful Practices: Course 2
SEL Competencies and Experiential Practices

CASEL’s Three Signature Practices

CASEL developed 3 Signature Practices as a tool for fostering a supportive environment that promotes Social-Emotional Learning. These practices include:

  • 1. Welcoming Inclusion Activity, Routine, or Ritual

    A welcoming inclusion activity, routine, or ritual is done during non-instructional time. It builds community and connects to the work ahead.

    Examples include:

    • Greeting: Smile warmly and greet each person by their preferred name
    • Whole-group greeting activities
    • Morning circles
    • Interactive "do-nows"
  • 2. Engaging Strategies

    Embed engaging strategies during instructional time to anchor thinking and learning throughout the experience.

    Engaging strategies offer many opportunities that vary in complexity to practice SEL skills. Examples include:

    • Jigsaw
    • Turn and Talk
    • Mindfulness Breaks
  • 3. Optimistic Closure

    Close each experience in an intentional way. An optimistic closure is not necessarily a "cheery ending," but rather highlights an individual and shared understanding of the importance of the work, and can provide a sense of accomplishment and support forward-thinking.

    Examples include:

    • 1-Word checkout
    • 1-Minute Accolade
